result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel R Heinlein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Avoid Penalty, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs, including DNA surcharge in the amount of $250.00.  **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.  **NOTE: $500.00 of Defendant's bond money has been applied towards the Court costs leaving a balance due of $28.00.
----------------------------

No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No prescription medication without a valid perscription and must be taken in prescribed amounts. No driving without a valid license.
----------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. Undergo any other evaluation required of him and follow through with any treatment recommended by Agent.
----------------------------
AODA assessment and follow through with any counseling/treatment  recommendations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel R Heinlein

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
8:28 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
DA Zeke S Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Daniel R Heinlein in court with Atty David A Danz.  
Matter is on this morning for plea & sentencing on 15CT344; and for sentencing on 15CF473.  
There is no agreement as to sentence and parties will be arguing to the Court.  
Plea hearing:  15CT344;  
Court has plea colloquy with Mr. Heinlein.  
Deft enters Guilty plea to Ct #1;  Ct. #2 is dismissed & read-in.  
Deft acknowledges prior convictions.  
Court gives warnings with regard to deportation if not citizen.  
Court makes findings and adjudges defendant Guilty of Ct. 1 - 15CT344;  

Atty Danz has reviewed the PSI with his client.  
8:34 am  Atty Wiedenfeld makes record as to compliance with victims rights.  
8:35 am  Argument as to sentence by DA Wiedenfeld.  
8:44 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty Danz.  Atty Danz advises that his client was held in custody in Illinois for 20 days before he was brought up here.  Court asks that Atty Danz provide records to confirm this.   
8:56 am  Statement by defendant.  Response by Deft to Court's questions.  
8:58 am  Court makes record and proceedings with sentencing deft.  
9:16 am  Court in recess.  

SENTENCE - 15CF473:  
Sentence withheld - 3 years probation;  
1)  Pay court costs.  
2)  Maintain employment.  
3)  No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  No prescription medication without a valid prescription and must be taken in prescribed amounts.  
4)  No driving without a valid license.  
5)  No weapons.  
6)  AODA assessment and follow through with any counseling / treatment recommendations.  
7)  Undergo any other evaluation required of him and follow through with any treatment recommended by Agent.  

SENTENCE - 15CT344:  
180 days in Jail to commence forthwith (8/3/2017) - NO work release.  
May have a furlough to attend the next VIP on 08/08/2017 at 6:30 pm;  Furlough will start at 5:30 pm on the date of VIP and he must return to jail after it finishes.  
**Atty Danz will provide information to support dead time credit while deft was held in Illinois.  JOC will then be amended to include those days.  
$1800.00 fine plus court costs.  
Thirty (30) months DL revocation and I.I.D.;  
A & R;  
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  

Court warns deft:  1)  May not vote until civil rights are restored; 2)  May not possess firearms;  9:15 am  Court in recess.

Court in session at 2:32 pm.  
ADA Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Daniel R Heinlein in court, in custody with attorney David A Danz.  
Matter on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing on 15CT344 and Plea Hearing on 15CF473.
Request for adjournment by Atty Danz for unforeseen circumstances.  No objection by DA. 
Court will allow continuance out approximately 3 weeks.  
Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 3, 2017 at 08:15 am.  
Court in recess 2:37 pm.
Order For Defendant's Appearance at Department of Corrections for Pre-Sentence Investigation report.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Daniel R Heinlein in court with attorney David A Danz.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter set out for sentencing. PSI ordered.   Minutes filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 3, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Daniel R Heinlein in court with attorney David A Danz.  Zeke S. Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 6, 2017 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for April 10, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Order Copies provided to Counsel in Court on this date

Defendant Daniel R Heinlein in court with attorney David A Danz.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
Original Warrant filed with the court.
Signed bond filed with the court.

TOTAL BOND COVERS ALL FILES 15CF473 & 15CT344
MUST POST $500.00 CASH
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH M.H.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Daniel R Heinlein in court with attorney David A Danz.  Andrew R. Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Waiver of Prelim scheduled for September 26, 2016 at 01:15 pm.  Arraignment scheduled for September 26, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Defendant Daniel R Heinlein not in court.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court issues warrant. Minutes filed.
